organizations: Dodge City.Isreal Watson of 6A Shawnee Mission West
Shawnee Mission Northwest.Bryce Lytle of 5A Great Bend
title: Week 7: Top Box Scores
text: Week 7: Top Box Scores Ben Mitchum Talk about it in the kansasgridiron Message Boards Week Seven in Kansas high school action saw one running back approach the 2,000 yard mark after just seven games, while another ran for more than 400 yards last Friday night. In one of the best efforts of the season, an 8-Man athlete waged a one-man assault on the stat sheet with a tremendous all-around performance. KansasGridiron takes a look around the week that was in the latest edition of Top Box Scores. Rushing Harry Trotter of 3A Maur Hill had a huge night, carrying the ball 22 times for 430 yards and four touchdowns in a 62-20 victory over Atchison County.4A-II Andale Zachary Meyer ran for 365 yards and six scores on just 19 carries in a 59-24 win over Wichita Trinity.4A-II Osawatomie running back Riley England rolled up 377 yards and four TDs in a 48-20 triump over Prairie View. England leads the state with 1,915 yards rushing on the season.4A-I Ulysses RB Ian Rudzik rushed for 278 yards on two TDs in a 34-31 victory over Mulvane. Rudzik also had a big interception in the ballgame. Passing Will Schneider of 6A Shawnee Mission North was 23 of 32 for 329 yards and 4 TDs in a 49-30 win over Wyandotte. Schneider is one of the top junior quarterbacks in the state.Joey Dolan of 6A Blue Valley North completed 14 of 22 for 319 yards passing and five TDs. The Mustangs shut out Shawnee Mission South 48-0.Will Bruna of 8-Man I Hanover threw for 282 yards and eight scores on 13 of 17 attempts in a 68-22 victory over Lakeside-Downs.Zac Walter of 8-Man I Lincoln had a huge night all-around in a 42-39 nail biter victory over Mankato-Rock Hills. Walther completed 16 of 19 for 214 yards and a TD, while adding 213 yards on five more scores on the ground. Defensively, he led the way with 19 tackles and three tackles for loss in his squad's district opener. Receiving 6A Wichita Northwest receiver Alex Bott had eight receptions for 185 yards and three TDs in a 52-33 win over Dodge City.Isreal Watson of 6A Shawnee Mission West had five catches for 170 yards and two scores in a 45-6 victory over 6A Shawnee Mission Northwest.Bryce Lytle of 5A Great Bend had eight catches for 151 yards and a TD in a 52-21 victory over Newton. Lytle is ranked in the top five in the state in receiving yards with 728.6A Blue Valley North receiver Alex Blake hauled in six passes for 150 yards and four TDs in a 48-0 victory over Shawnee Mission South. Top Defensive Performances 2A Syracuse picked up its second consecutive win with a 44-8 victory over Elkhart. The Bulldogs forced six Elkhart turnovers, with five fumbles and an interception.Linebacker Regan Steele of 3A St. Mary's Colgan collected 23 tackles in a 54-21 loss to Rock Creek.Linebacker Cole Sramek of 8-Man I Atwood-Rawlins County registered 21 tackles and three tackles for a loss in a 40-6 victory over Logan-Palco.Linebacker Brandon Shook of 6A Wichita Northwest had only 10 tackles on the night, but 7.5 of them were tackles for a loss and four sacks in a 52-33 win over Dodge City. Kansas NEWS
